reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We Stayed at the Win for four nights. The rooms were clean and provided all the necessities. The Staff was excellent and most helpful. They allowed us to keep our luggage there when we went to Sapa and return at 5am from the night train and leave our things there until our room was ready. The staff went out of there way to be accommodating and friendly. The location is great, a quiet street and close to everything.
reviews.title: the Win is a winner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz and Hanoi Elegance, which also lived up to their recommendations and are great places, but felt the Win was best because of location and chill and accommodating staff.
reviews.title: Great Value & Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: thank you!
reviews.title: Winner

likes.liked: — Location, Friendliness of staff, quality of room and amenities
likes.disliked: — Being steered to owner's eyeglass place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Simple hotel excellent location one block from central lake in Hanoi. Rooms are nothing special, but they're inexpensive and clean. Rooms are quiet and equipped with cable and safe. Located on quiet street with plenty of restaurant options. Service was friendly and attentive - including delivery of coffee to my room at 5am so I could catch early flight. Free, fast internet in lobby. Delightfully surprised.
reviews.title: Best budget hotel; great rooms, friendly staff, good location in old town

likes.liked: — friendly staff, nice decorated big rooms; good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Win is in a great location on a small curved street about
reviews.title: Good value for money and great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Win Hotel would have to be in one of the best locations in the Old Quarter in Hanoi. It's so easy to get to all the main attractions and great restaurants. The staff at so friendly and helpful and made my stay with them a real pleasure. I stayed in 3 different types of rooms over a 10 day period (cause I was coming and going). The Superior Suite at $30 a night was great. Big room with twin beds and bath tub and balcony. The Junior Suite was equally as good but a bit smaller with a double bed. The normal suite had a double bed and bathroom but no window at all. All the rooms were really quiet and absoulty spotless. They are cleaned everyday with new towels and water replaced. Washing is so cheep there as well. They kept my suitcase while I went away on overnight trips and organised taxis, what was really great is that Internet access is free there and although the breakfast is basic and served in the foyer, it's nice and fresh. Overall I would highly recommened the Win Hotel for your stay in Hanoi.
reviews.title: Win Hotel is a Winner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a friends recommendation we stayed at the win hotel and was not disappointed. We stayed in two rooms, one US$20 per night and the other US$30 and each was excellent and very clean. The extra touches to the rooms made it stand out from the other guesthouses and hotels we stayed at during our 10 weeks in south-east asia.
reviews.title: Best hote. Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service provided by the manager (can't remember his name) was unbelievable. Before arriving in Hanoi he helped us book a day trip around Hanoi and tour to Halong Bay. Both were excellent and compared to stories from other travellerss the tours were both cheaper and of a better standard than other companies. The manager even recommended cheaper tours which he thought were better value than the more expensive ones.
reviews.title: Great price, great location, great staff.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most amazing part of his services was as follows - we had asked one of his staff members to book us a Vietnam Airlines flight from Saigon/HSMC to Bangkok. Although we were happy with the price, he recommended that we change to Thai Airlines and offered to cancel the other flight and arrange it all for us - all in order to save us US$5 each. He was not pushy at all and was only trying to save us some money.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We loved the Win Hotel - it was by far the best place we stayed during our 10 weeks in South-east Asia
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in 2 rooms - a large double with a balcony for $30 and a smaller windowless double for $20. Both rooms were comfortable, and clean with nice furniture. We were a bit uncomfortable with not having a window the second time back, as it felt a little claustrophobic, but it was our choice to have a cheaper room then. I think what sets this hotel apart is the street it's on - a quiet leafy streat that is a bit less hectic than many streets north of the lake, but is also within easy walking distance of that area. The staff at the Win are also very friendly.
reviews.title: The Win is a good budget choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: During 1 week in Hanoi we stayed in 3 different hotels and this was by far the best: incredibly friendly staff and large, comfortable rooms. The interior is nothing special (a little old fashioned even) and the breakfast is plentiful but served in the hotel lobby as there's nowhere else to serve it, but... the staff are so helpful and the location is excellent. Very good value for money!
reviews.title: Good value for money friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed for an extended period at the Win hotel, and will certainly be back in the future! The staff took very good care of us. They are friendly and personable. All the desk staff speak great English. We selected the larger room option, on the 4th floor with a balcony overlooking Hang Hanh street. The room had two double size beds, that were very comfortable. The rooms also come with a refrigerator. Bathroom had good features – including a full bathtub with shower. Our room was large for the price, and kept very clean. It was very quiet at night. Breakfast was included, and was always very good and quite filling. For a taste of Vietnam, try the sticky rice option! This hotel is conveniently located in the center of the historic district-- its just a 3 minute walk to Hoan Kiem Lake, and a 5 minute walk to the Cathedral.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — wireless internet connection in my room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Win hotel according to the good reviews it had and it deserved them really!!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Incredible nice staff which just helped us with leaving the luggage for one week there since we were on a trekking, bathroom for shower in case your plane/train was leaving late, simple but tasty breakfast and big and useful rooms.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Win during our first week in Hanoi. We booked it through vietnamstay.com. We figured we might be too tired to deal with the taxi stand so we arranged for a car to pick us up and take us to the Win ($13). The driver was waiting for us when we left customs and took us right to the hotel with no problems. Upon our arrival we were warmly greeted and taken to a room with a balcony, just as we requested. Can't remember the name of the front desk manager but he was great. Whatever we needed he was there for us. We split up our stay with them as we had booked a couple of excursions out of Hanoi (Mai Chau & Halong Bay). We were able to leave our bags at the hotel and upon each return found them waiting for us in our room with a view every time. This was nice after returning from a long day on the road. The Win's location is great and I plan on returning with my Dad next year.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just spent a week at the Win, and we loved it. The staff is professional, competent, knowledgable, friendly and helpful. The hotel is extremely clean and very well-run. The location is unbeatable, the street quiet and charming. We made our booking directly with the hotel via email; they respond to every email/question/inquiry within 24 hours. Airport pickup went smoothly, for starters. Of the 10 rooms the 4 superior rooms are clearly the best. They are huge, have lots of light, good bathrooms and balconies facing the street. (We caught glimpses of the other rooms, they seem nice as well.) We booked a 3-day trip to Halong Bay through the Win (the day before going there) which was absolutely wonderful. We met another couple on the boat who had booked the identical trip through a travel agency in Hanoi. They paid 15% more.
reviews.title: the Win is a winner

likes.disliked: — internet access doesn't work in all corners of the room but this is really a minor point.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our third trip to Vietnam but the first stay at the Win. I warmly recommend this hotel, would go back in a flash.
reviews.title: Win is no. 1

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, rooms, location - all basic needs met with a touch of class
likes.disliked: — climbing stairs to 5th floor at the end of a long day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Beate from New York City
reviews.title: Great Place! Even better staff and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our group of 5 booked 3 rooms at Win....Initial room bookings not quite as expected but very friendly staff were only too willing to meet our needs. We had 2 nights and later returned for a further 1 night. Staff (family) very welcoming - rooms very clean and bright - I can highly recommend the front rooms - they are HUGE and very bright and friendly. Location is fantastic - just round the corner from Hoam Kiem Lake. During our 3 week stay in Vietnam, this hotel was right up there for value for money.
reviews.title: nice staff
